definitions: To have an unpleasant, disturbing, or jarring effect.
To send a painful or unpleasant shock through (someone or something).
To strike or collide with something, typically with a jarring or unpleasant effect.
To vibrate or shake because of an impact or shock.
examples: The loud noise jarred my nerves.
The car jarred as it hit the pothole.
The impact jarred the entire building.
